summary: A wrapper program that allows for more advanced use of the Papyrus compiler from within Creation Kit.
descriptionHtml:
[b][size=4]Advanced Papyrus[/size][/b]
A wrapper program that allows for more advanced use of the Papyrus compiler from within Creation Kit.

[b][size=4]Installing[/size][/b]
- Copy [i]Advanced Papyrus.exe[/i] to [i]"\Skyrim\Papyrus Compiler\"[/i].
- Rename [i]PapyrusCompiler.exe[/i] to [i]PapyrusCompiler - Original.exe[/i].
- Rename [i]Advanced Papyrus.exe[/i] to [i]PapyrusCompiler.exe[/i].
If you've installed Advanced Papyrus correctly, then you should see the output of the Papyrus compiler in Creation Kit start with:
[quote]Advanced Papyrus: MESSAGE[/quote][i]MESSAGE[/i] will be about passing through unmodified arguments or modifying arguments to take into account an INI file.
If you've forgotten to rename the old Papyrus compiler executable to [i]PapyrusCompiler - Original.exe[/i], then an error message will be printed in the output.
See the Features section on the [url=https://github.com/Kapiainen/Advanced-Papyrus]Github repo[/url] for information on how to use the various features of Advanced Papyrus.

[b][size=4]Features[/size][/b]
[b][size=3]Argument modification[/size][/b]
Arguments sent by Creation Kit to the Papyrus compiler can be modified by copying [i]Advanced Papyrus.ini[/i] to [i]"\Skyrim\Papyrus Compiler"[/i] and modifying it to suit your needs. If you don't copy [i]Advanced Papyrus.ini[/i] or use [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/60810/]SublimePapyrus[/url], then arguments sent from Creation Kit will just pass through unmodified.

[b][size=4]Mod Organizer[/size][/b]
Advanced Papyrus is useful when running Creation Kit via [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/1334/]Mod Organizer[/url] since you don't need to modify the Papyrus compiler and you can keep all of your script source files separated.
You should modify [i]Advanced Papyrus.ini[/i] (or [i]SublimePapyrus.ini[/i], if you use SublimePapyrus) so that the [i]output[/i] option points to the [i]"\Mod Organizer\overwrite\Scripts"[/i]:
[quote]output=Path\To\Mod Organizer\overwrite\scripts[/quote]You should also have a [i]path[/i] option that points to [i]"\Mod Organizer\Scripts\Source"[/i]:
[quote]path0=Path\To\Mod Organizer\overwrite\scripts\source[/quote]
author: MrJack

files.name: Advanced Papyrus
files.changelogHtml:
- Added better error handling. Odd/missing values in INI files should now be brought to your attention by the program along with the name of the file that is the source of the problem.

- Added support for debug/advanced arguments.

files.name: Advanced Papyrus
files.changelogHtml:
- The Papyrus compiler's error stream was mistakenly being sent to the
output stream of the wrapper rather than the error stream, but that has
now been corrected.
